intro: Thlaspi jaubertii, commonly known as the Jaubert's cabbageworm, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in racemes. It produces small, round, pale green or yellow fruits called siliques. Thlaspi jaubertii is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and is adapted to cold, arid conditions.
